events.name: Joining the GDG Düsseldorf March event

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
GDG Düsseldorf is a gathering of people with a passion for technology - many of them developers, others project leaders, web designers and other IT/technology related roles or interests. The group is mixed; People who have worked for a long time in the same field, people who just started, people who are changing careers, people who are students.  Every month there is an event where members and invitees present various topics connected to IT/technology. 

The  next event is scheduled for March 24. This time we are focusing on business related topics; Entrepreneurship (did you ever hear about Google Launch, a program to support new businesses on Google platform? We will have a presentation about Google Launch/Google Launchpad, and another one of our members will talk about Android Work.

Please come and join us at this shared event! 

To find out more, visit the event on Google Plus, GDG Düsseldorf March event

We would be happy to see you attend - GDG Düsseldorf is open to anyone with an interest in IT/Technology! 

Please also remember to RSVP so we know whom to expect (and can make sure there are enough chairs for everyone).
events.how_to_find_us: Through the door and up the stairs - we are hard to miss. GarageSpace Bilk is just a short walk away from Bilk S, if you come by tram or train.

events.name: Join GDG Düsseldorf in April for the Android Adventure
events.description:
GDG Düsseldorf are arranging the monthly Meetup April 28 - as a WTM member, come and join us!
I'll be there - will you? Here is what they say: 

To all the green robots out there: On the 28th of April our next meeting will take place - please mark the date in your calendars!

Hello GDG’ers,

Frederick Schweiger, our organizer of the month, has good news! We are proud to announce our next meetup on the 28th of April. Our annual April’s ‘Android Abend’ will take place for the first time - ever :-)

We’ll have brilliant speakers with three awesome presentations waiting to be heard by you - the topics range from Android Auto Media over RxJava to improving your productivity using Trello.

The presentations: Wolfram Rittmeyer and +Pascal Welsch will introduce you to the world of RxJava. +Resul Kocyigit is going to make some noise - he introduces us to the media universe on Android Auto and, last but not least, +Johan Bove puts the cherry on the cake with his talk about the project management application Trello and how to use it to get things done.

As usual, this event and the extremely delicious pizza will be sponsored by Scaratec. Check them out here. Hope to see you all there! April 28, at 19 o’clock!

PS: Please remember to register for the event here, on GDG:s Meetup page or on Google Plus

OH - and feel free to join the WTM Düsseldorf Google Plus Community!

events.name: Wohoo - Google I/O Extended with GDG Düsseldorf
events.description:
Notice! To sign up use Eventbrite!  For THIS event you cannot sign up via the Meetup Group. Location is not shown on this site. 

Attention!!! The Meetup is THURSDAY May 28! Come and join!

GDG Düsseldorf is arranging Google I/O Extended - and of course those in WTM are equally welcome. 

Google I/O is a huge tech conference/tech fair, that takes place in California, Silocon Valley, every year. Usually there are interesting news in the tech field presented at Google I/O. Google I/O Extended is an extention of the fair, where, for one of the days, people gather around the globe, in various location, to listen in to the talks, learn about the news, and, of course, to socialise, talk about technology and about the future in technology. It is an excellend event, lots of fun, and I can guarantee that if you want to you will learn a lot, we all do. Read more about it on GDG Düsseldorf's Google Plus page, and sign up via Eventbrite.

Notice! Event HERE will not be updated, this is just used to lead you to the GDG event.

Yoou have to check Google Plus and Eventbrite for the updates, and to sign up!

See you there!

events.name: High Performance Android Apps with GDG Düsseldorf

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
It is that time again!

Together with GDG Düsseldorf we arrange the  OCTOBER meetup! This time we are very excited to have an external speaker - Douglass Sillars from US. Doug is an android specialist, and his talk,  "High Performance Android Apps: Easy Tips for Speed, Power and Data" will give us some very concrete tips, his job at AT&T is "to help developers make their apps run faster, use the network more efficiently, and save battery usage" - and that's a direct quote.

We are very excited to have the opportunity to invite you to meet with and listen to Doug talk. This is a very special opportunity that shouldn't be missed - it isn't often our calendar matches the calendars of international travellers.

So come and join us!

And for those who sadly can't make it - take the opportunity to check out the free tool from AT&T - the  "Application Resource Optimizer"  (ARO) -

developer.att.com/ARO

Hope to see you there! 

And stay tuned! While we haven't had our October event yet, November is already in the planning, in November we step away from Android for a while and focus on Web. ﻿
events.how_to_find_us: Through the gate, across the court yard and through a little door at the very end. We are up the stairs.

events.name: Firebase and Polymer together with GDG Düsseldorf

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
NOVEMBER is soon here!

For our November Meetup we are leaving Android for a while and focus on Web and web applications: Firebase and Polymer is on our agenda.

This time we have both an external speaker, Juarez Filho, who will talk about Firebase, and our own Parththipan (whose name Ann-Katrin is notoriously bad at spelling, sorry if I didn't get it right) who will talk Polymer - and there is a possibility that there will be one more talk, I hear...

Firebase and Polymer together makes up for a very interesting evening, and we are very excited to invite you to an evening of tech talks, mingling, and many laughs.

Come and join us!

Parththipan most of you know already, he needs no further introduction.

Juarez is coming in from Brussels, he is home in Brazil but currently is in Europe for work and for a little "Tour of Europe" - he is taking the opportunity to join Devfests and GDG meetups across the region - and we were lucky enough to find a date that suited him, just before he heads back what is summer in Brazil.

Hope to see as many as possible at our November event - and feel free to invite others, just try and respond on the event site so we have a clue how many to expect.

See you there!

And remember; You can also find GDG Düsseldorf on Google Plus - and Women Techmakers DUS are also there
events.how_to_find_us: Through the gate, over the court yard, to the very end, through a door and up the stairs - we are in the big room, it's easy to find us.

events.name: StudyJam Android for Beginners with GDG Düsseldorf - sign up via GDG Düsseldorf
events.description:
Ladies! Come and join us! 

Under the GDG Düsseldorf flag we are organising a Study Jam weekend, Android for Beginners! - follow the link to the event page to sign up. 

Sign-up can ONLY be done via the GDG Düsseldorf event - see here:

http://www.meetup.com/Google-Developer-Group-Dusseldorf/events/229708627/

Have you got an interest in Technology?

Are you curious to learn programming? 

Do you want to become a creator of technology but don’t know where to start?

Do you have a smartphone, or an interest in Smartphones? Do you specifically have an interest in Android?

Well, this might just be the perfect opportunity for you!

The topic for this year’s Study Jam season is Android for Beginners - read more about it on the event site, GDG Düsseldorf. 

What IS a Study Jam? Study Jams are community driven events, where we get together to learn. The great thing about Study Jams is that we can support and inspire each other - and, because it is an organised event, we also have a facilitator who will be able to assist when we get stuck. We will be using the Udacity course Android for Beginners for this Study Jam.

Sign up via the GDG Düsseldorf meetup site - space is limited so best be quick...

events.name: Scrum + Game Development with Android and Google Cast

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
Together with GDG Düsseldorf we would like to invite you to the April Meetup. Two talks are scheduled:

"How to do Scrum without killing yourself"
Scrum, an agile framework originally used for software development projects, but today used in more fields and in various industries - but what does it really mean? GDG Düsseldorf member Phillip, with plenty of experience with Scrum will be holding a talk about how to use Scrum without losing ourselves - a much needed talk in times where being “agile” is sometimes used as an excuse for not needing a plan. Looking forward to learn more! This is a talk that makes sense to anyone involved in especially software development projects, whether it's front end or back end, web or mobile, corporate or freelance. 

The second talk will be  Game Development for Android and Cast with Unity. Abdülhamit, another of our GDG Düsseldorf members, is a professional Unity Developer and he will be holding this talk, showing us how to integrate Google Cast into a game. 

Come and join us for an interesting evening of tech talks, networking, learning and general fun. 

As so often before the event will take place at the coworking space Garage Bilk, something we can thank our sponsor SCARATEC for. 

Hope to see you at yet another interesting evening together with our great community.

The biggest thank you goes to the community, it is the community that makes GDG Düsseldorf and Women Techmakers great and we are depending on you! 

If you are interested in contributing to our community by holding a talk yourself, contact one of the organisers - we are always open for new ideas and suggestions; And a talk can be a long talk or a short talk, a blitz talk for 5 minutes or even a workshop - tell us what you want to do and we'll try and find the fitting format.

events.name: Google I/O Extended with GDG Düsseldorf - signup via Meetup GDG Dus
events.description:
Come and join us for our Google I/O extended on the first day of Google I/O, May 18 (the whole conference runs May 18-20, but the I/O Extended event is limited to one evening).

We do the Google I/O Extended as part of GDG Düsseldorf - sign up via the GDG Dus Meetup page

We'll gather, mingle, talk about tech, watch the Google I/O keynotes, and network.

Notice! This event is taking place in a special location, so make sure you really DO sign up and find out the details. Space is limited, so make sure you sign up! Signup via GDG Düsseldorf - since space is limited this is a must. A waiting list is available. It is automatic, which means if the event is full but someone cancels, the people on the waiting list will automatically be moved to "attending" - so if you don't get a space but are waitlisted, remember to keep an eye on the mail and on the Meetup website. Remember to keep your RSVP up to date - cancel your attendance if you cannot make it, so someone else can join instead. You can respond for you + one additional person - but if your friend/colleague isn't joining in the end, remember to remove the +1.

events.name: WTM at DroidCon DE
events.description:
DroidCon DE, a big Android conference in Berlin.

I will be there and we have several speakers from Düsseldorf. 

Are you planning on coming to Berlin as well? 

If you already have your ticket, join the event and we'll meet at the GDG Booth during the event.

If you don't have a ticket yet but want to join, you'll have to go through the DroidconDE website

Notice! This is NOT a free event. GDG is represented at DroidCon but we are NOT the organisers. This is just a nice opportunity to meet up if you are going to be at DroidCon.

I will be in Berlin myself and I would be delighted to hear from any other members of Women Techmakers how may join. I attended last year as well and it was a very inspiring event.

Kind regards,

Ann-Katrin
events.how_to_find_us: Send a message on Meetup and we'll decide time and place - meet at the GDG Booth!

events.name: #GDGDUS June event - Android and Fingerprints followed by an Accessibility talk

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
Now, on short notice - here is, WTM and GDG together,  our June 2016 event!

Fresh from DroidconDE: 

Frederik Schweiger presents "Security at your Fingertips. A dive into Marshmallow's new fingerprint and Keystore APIs". 

Our second talk is Accessibility, usability taken one step further (and it's good business too), a non-android talk, which may be interesting for both Android-ers and web developers, as well as general techies. 

Additionally to our normal talks Randy will give us a brief overview of Dart - which may work as an inspiration; In October there will be a DART summit in Munich.

 Come and join us June 28, at Garagespace Bilk! 

And what do you know - we timed it so there is no football on the day, at least no Euro 2016. 

 See you there!

 Come learn, mingle, and get inspired. We dare promise there will be an update from Google I/O as well. 

Please let us know if you plan to be there, and notice - you can of course bring techie friends who wants to learn more!
events.how_to_find_us: Garagespace Bilk, through the gate, over the (scarily empty courtyard) and through the door at the far end, and up the stairs. We are in the big room - you'll see and hear us.

events.name: Responsive Webapps & IoT - Let's get Physical; Beacons, Nearby API and more

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
#GDGDUS - GDG Düsseldorf - and WTM - Women Techmakers Düsseldorf have our next meetup coming up - July 27 at Garagespace Bilk

First an introduction to Progressive Web apps and then we will talk Google Nearby API, Edystone, beacons and  Internet of Things in an Android talk. 

Christopher, who attended the Progressive Web Apps event in Amsterdam earlier this year will guide us through Progressive Webapps, and Pascal will present his talk from Droidcon in Berlin in June, "Let's get physical - with Nearby and Eddystone" (link here).

And what IS a "Progressive Web App"? In short, directly from the source:

• Progressive - Work for every user, regardless of browser choice because they’re built with progressive enhancement as a core tenet.

• Responsive - Fit any form factor: desktop, mobile, tablet, or whatever is next.

• Connectivity independent - Enhanced with service workers to work offline or on low quality networks.

• App-like - Feel like an app to the user with app-style interactions and navigation because they’re built on the app shell model.

 In short, Progressive Web Apps are enablers, especially with the offline functionality, improving the user experience for your users  and potentially increasing business for business owners. As designers and developers we need to understand the latest and the greatest - and Christopher will give us our first introduction.

Pascal Welsch needs no further introduction, an experienced Android developer who is a long time member of GDG and have presented many interesting topics - now Pascal is back.

We will be learning more about Edystone beacons, the nearby API (Trello uses this, for example) and lots more. Put a beacon on your coffee mug and never lose it again? 

As a little add-on, a surprise, we also have an interesting an inspiring talk about something completely different - related to tech, of course, but this one takes beyond the traditional space - come and join and see for yourself. 

As always, networking, having a snack, catching up with everyone and getting engaged in new and interesting topics is half the fun - so come and join us even if you don't immediately feel you can use what you learn from the talks, I can guarantee that you'll always learn something, if you come with an open mind and bring a smile. Our discussions are always interesting.
events.how_to_find_us: Through the gate, over the courtyard, to a door that looks kind of anonymous, open the door and come up the stairs. We are in the room to the right.

events.name: TechEd, Flutter and Mobile Development and more
events.description:
Together with GDG Düsseldorf - Women Techmakers Düsseldorf 

For September we have two talks

Gisele is introducing us to Teched - 

Learning and Tech update 

an update on what's going on, with a chance to do some hands-on exercises. 

Our second talk is by Dmitry, a long time member: 
Mobile development, Material Design and what Dart has to do with all that 

This talk will be about Flutter framework, a Dart VM + brand new UI framework heavily focused on Material Design. Please mark the date in your calendars and come and join us at GarageSpace Bilk on Bilker Allee

Bring an open and curious mind and a good mood and and come and join us for tech, networking and inspiration!

See you all in September!

events.name: Women Techmakers Brunch and casual get-together
events.description:
Ladies/women and anyone who don't identify as a man

Let's get together for a Women Techmakers, WTM Brunch in Düsseldorf, to chat about diversity, tech and how we want to organise ourselves and what we want to do as Women Techmakers in Düsseldorf, and how we can lean in and support each other. 

Women Techmakers is an organisation supported by, among others, Google, and partner up with Anita Borg Insitute, Hackbright Academy, Women Who Code and many more. We are a part of GDG, Google Developer Group, an independent network of techies and developers. 

WTM is for women in tech, or with an interest in tech - tech and being a woman in tech is our focus.

This event is for women and those who don't identify as men. (Kids are of course welcome with their parents but there is no baby sitting service - this is just a casual get-together)

Bigger WTM events and tech talks are open to women and those who support us regardless of gender but during this brunch we want to take the opportunity to network and talk about how to build a stronger WTM network lifting up the female voices. We also want to keep it relatively small this time, hence this time we are for those who identify themselves as women or non-male only. 

In Düsseldorf we have previously made a big effort to increase female attendance and talk about diversity at other events, especially the GDG events, but now it is time we get together on our own. 

Notice! WTM events are an add-on to other tech events, you are very much encouraged to attend GDG events as well as other events - WTM will never replace those events and for Düsseldorf the concept with WTM will be different than with GDG; there is no point in copying a good concept, when we can have both!

So come and join for our first WTM Düsseldorf stand-alone get-together. 

We will meet at Brasserie Düsseldorf, on Kasernenstrasse 44 - that is down by Graf Adolf Plats, at the ground floor of the high building often referred to as "GAP15"

Looking forward to seeing you there!

Notice! This is a free event but everyone is expected to buy their own drinks and food. 

Also: Please remember to keep your RSVP up to date, we have a limited number of seats and will need to make a reservation so it is important that we have the correct information.  I, too, realise that things might come up, but please update RSVP if that's the case. 

While we'll meet on "neutral ground" this first time. Reason behind is we want to really be able to have an open discussion - and we don't want it to be an event with promotional content. However we are definitely open for other formats in the future, so if you have access to a location and want to host an event - get in touch with Ann-Katrin on womentechmakers _ at_ gdgdus.com

events.name: WTM Brunch - Brunch with Women Techmakers Düsseldorf
events.description:
It's been way too long, mainly because of my crazy schedule, but it's time to do something about that!

There is so much to talk about, so much to share and so much going on

Let's meet for brunch, we start at 11:30 and the official time will be 3 hours, depending on how long people want to stay, but who know, maybe we go on for longer.

A casual meetup to talk tech, women in tech, share experiences and enjoy.

I'll also take the opportunity to update you on what happened at Google I,/O in May and at Google Developer Days in Krakow in September.

We will meet at Frida's, a Tapas Bar just next to Bilker Kirche, where a table has been reserved.

Please make sure you keep your RSVP up to date. You can also respond with guests but please update your info if your friend/friends can't make it. This event is for women, those who don't identify as men, and those who support us women in tech.

(Everyone keeps track of what they order, we pay separately)

Frida's is conveniently located at Bilker Kirche in Düsseldorf, look for the yellow building facing the entrance of the church.

You can come here either by tram, 707, 706 and a few more stop right outside, by bus, or by train to Völklinger Strasse (S8, S11 and S28)

Looking forward to seeing you!

events.name: Join #GDGDUS October Meetup - Flutter and Android Things
events.description:
GDGDUS, Google Developer Group Düsseldorf is organising a get-together with tech talks and more on the 5th of October. 

Want to come along? Join GDGDus on meetup, and sign up, or simply sign up via the Eventbrite link - there are still tickets left. 

Ann-Katrin will be there, will you join too? If you sign up via Women Techmakers Ann-Katrin will keep an extra eye open and we can go there together!

This meetup will be quite tech focused and we'll be learning more about mobile development.

Dylan Dorst from Netherlands will talk about  Flutter and  Said Tahsin Dane, Google Developer Expert, GDE, is coming in from Berlin to talk about Android Things. This is a very special opportunity and if you are interested in mobile development you don't want to miss it. 

Read more on the event page or on the GDGDus Meetup page.

As always with GDG the events are open to everyone but please do sign up, so we know how many people to expect.  You don't have to be an expert or even a developer, but it is assumed that you have an interest in tech and in the topics and want to learn - pretty much a given. 

It would be great to see you!

PS! Yes, event is free!

events.name: WTM Brunch - Coffee and Tech Talk
events.description:
Let's meet, talk tech, diversity, share experiences
Ann-Katrin will be able to share experiences from GDD, Google Developer Days in Krakow, and talk about other events coming up, and potential WTM events - WTM is what we make it!

Hoping to see many of you there!

Everyone orders what suits them and we pay separately. Since space is limited, please remember to keep your RSVP up to date.

Looking forward!

We have something for everyone, hardcore super techie or beginner; we can all learn from each other! Meetup is open for all - all that is needed is that you support women in tech and diversity in general
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be inside, place is small so it's easy to spot us, look for the woman in a red scarf, that's Ann-Katrin

events.name: DACHfest 2018 (Devfest DACH region)
events.description:
For this year's DevFest season, GDG and WTM communities of Germany, Austria, and Switzerland are all working together to organize our largest event yet: DACHFest!

*Notice! You HAVE to buy your ticket from https://www.dachfest.com - this is a paid event and you need your ticket. Responding on Meetup is not enough, nor needed*

DACHFest is a two-day DevFest conference focused on making a difference. Meet technology experts, discover all the different ways in which emerging technology is transforming lives, find out how to make your apps and websites friendly towards everyone, learn the secrets of building and nurturing a diverse community — let our speakers surprise and inspire you! And don't forget to make new friends: there will be plenty of opportunities to meet people passionate about your favorite things. ❤️

Join us in Munich on November 10–11 for two days full of talks, workshops, showcases, networking, and fun!

DACHFest is a paid event, but diversity scholarships are available for people who belong to underrepresented groups in tech or cannot afford a ticket.

Website: https://dachfest.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/dachfest

events.name: DACHfest 2018 (Devfest DACH region) - Day2 (same ticket)
events.description:
For this year's DevFest season, GDG and WTM communities of Germany, Austria, and Switzerland are all working together to organize our largest event yet: DACHFest!

*Notice! You HAVE to buy your ticket from https://www.dachfest.com - this is a paid event and you need your ticket. Responding on Meetup is not enough, nor needed*

DACHFest is a two-day DevFest conference focused on making a difference. Meet technology experts, discover all the different ways in which emerging technology is transforming lives, find out how to make your apps and websites friendly towards everyone, learn the secrets of building and nurturing a diverse community — let our speakers surprise and inspire you! And don't forget to make new friends: there will be plenty of opportunities to meet people passionate about your favorite things. ❤️

Join us in Munich on November 10–11 for two days full of talks, workshops, showcases, networking, and fun!

DACHFest is a paid event, but diversity scholarships are available for people who belong to underrepresented groups in tech or cannot afford a ticket.

Website: https://dachfest.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/dachfest

events.name: Brunch and tech chat in Düsseldorf
events.description:
For those who can't make it to DACHfest.de in Münich - it is time for a breakfast/brunch Meetup with tech chats and fun discussions in a relaxed environment here in Düsseldorf!

Bring: An open mind, a big heart and a thirst for coffee, knowledge and networking!
It would also be great if you came loaded with ideas for new meetups and chances to mingle - it is time we kick this group off again!

Beethoven is a cafe/restaurant in Flingern. On weekends as well as bank holidays they serve not only the standard menu but there is also a buffet available for those who wants that - for 14.90 Eur per person. Notice that everyone pays for themselves, with separate bills (restaurant has been been given heads-up) - and it is up to you if you want the buffet or if you prefer to order from the normal breakfast menu, with smaller items available. More information about the menu and the venue on www.beethoven-flingern.de

Come and join us!

Please notice! Since table is reserved it is really appreciated if you keep your RSVP current and up to date. If you plan to bring someone, please make sure you include them as well - or even better, ask them to join WTM as well, and sign up for themselves.
Needless to say we also need you to cancel your attendance if you in the end can't make it - please do so in due time, it is more fair on both the restaurant and those who are waiting.
events.how_to_find_us: Look for the woman in a red scarf - that ought to be Ann-Katrin

events.name: [ONLINE] DevFest On Air 2018 - December 11 and 12, various times
events.description:
First thing first: Depending on where you are, time might be different. Please check the LINK below to be sure you register and attend the correct time (or watch online later).

Register for #DevfestOnAir18 with Google, and read more about it here
https://devfest.withgoogle.com/events/devfestonair18

Now, with that said:

DevFest OnAir is an online conference featuring sessions from DevFest events around the globe. These community-led developer sessions are hosted by GDG (Google Developer Groups) focused on community, networking and learning about Google technologies. With over 500 communities and DevFest events happening all over the world, DevFest OnAir brings this global experience online for the first time!

*Rumours have it that DACHfest, the event organised in the DACH region this year, is also represented.*

Register online - this time there is no physical meetup

There will be exclusive content, there will be three different tracks, and there are different schedules per region/time zone and you can join the events you want.
The tracks are
Cloud
Mobile
Voice, Web & more.

Anyone can join, no matter where you are.
No need to sign up via Meetup - handle your signup via the link.

events.name: Google I/O Extended Viewing Party
events.description:
Google I/O Keynotes May 7 (keynotes start 19:00 sharp, broadcasted live from Mountain View, California)

May 7-9 it is time for Google I/O, the annual tech/developer conference organised by Google every year since 2008, where the latest news from Google are presented.

As every year Google I/O Extended viewing parties and tech meetups are organised across the globe - often timed with Google I/O Keynotes - and of course we would like to do the same, this time together with GDG.

Come and join us for Google I/O Extended, lets watch the keynotes together (starting 19:00 sharp) and talk about what's presented.
Doors open 18:00

We are very happy to have Trivago host us for this event - THANK you Trivago!

The event is free and open to everyone to attend.

To attend pre-registration and full name will be needed - it is a matter of safety in the building. Notice! Meetup only is NOT enough, it is a must to register via the form as well.

https://forms.gle/XMnzkep99SgPt7Ri7

Please notice! We are very happy for you to bring a friend or a colleague, remember to register your +1 or +2 as well - and remember to add them to the form. We DO need to have everyones first and last name in this case.

PS! A follow-up event is planned, some weeks after I/O, where we can dig deeper into whatever news Sundar Pichai and the teams at Google will present - but as we don't know what will be presented until the very moment they go on stage, you will have to wait for those details.

Notice! This event is posted in two groups as we host a shared event Women Techmakers/GDG - we expect to be[masked] people all in all. Would love to see you there too!
events.how_to_find_us: We will meet you at the door, signs will be put up and Ann-Katrin is the woman in the red scarf

events.name: Join FlutterSchool for their International Hackathon
events.description:
To attend THIS event you have to sign up via the Flutter-School Meetup page.

Join the Flutter School on Saturday, June 1st 2019 for the first ever all-day International Flutter Hackathon organised by over 2 dozen communities worldwide.

Read more here:
https://www.meetup.com/flutter-school/events/260401578/

Frederik, main organiser of Flutter School in Düsseldorf, has been involved in the overall planning of the Flutter Hackathon - and we expect this to be a fantastic experience. Frederik is also a long term member and organiser of GDG Düsseldorf, our mother organisation and we are together working for more diversity in tech- a long term goal of GDG and WTM.

Join a team of 2-5 fellow developers at your location to build something amazing in #Flutter and #Hummingbird. At the end of the event, all participants will vote on their favorite projects.

*Notice! Sign up via WTM is closed. This is because Flutter School needs to keep track of who's participating.*

The number of spaces is limited so sign up now!
https://www.meetup.com/flutter-school/events/260401578/

events.name: Go together to the Women In Big Data June event in Düsseldorf
events.description:
WiBD (Women in Big Data Düsseldorf) is a separate group for - well, you guessed it - Women in Big Data, with a similar goal as WTM (Women Techmakers).

Ann-Katrin is attending the event and it would be great to see more WTM members joining us as well. Normally special events are posted in our slack channel but to make sure you all see it we're also posting here.

If you do want to join, please sign up via the meetup group for WiBD
- https://www.meetup.com/Women-in-Big-Data-Dusseldorf/events/260445376/

If you add yourself to the list on WTM as well do keep an eye on the WiBD page, the information there will always be the most up to date.
We'll meet shortly before the WiBD event and join the event together, if you come late please go directly to the WiBD location.

It would be great to see you there!

answers.question: What's your favourite technical gadget? This just gives us a feeling for who you are and might hint to us what could be interesting to focus on.
answers.answer: I don't have one, or rather, it changes every week or even day. Anything with fun buttons to press. And my camera.

answers.question: What made you interested in the Techmakers group
answers.answer: It's important to empower women, tired of people assuming you have to be a certain way because of your dna. I don't believe in it.

answers.question: How did you find us? We are just curious to know, so we understand our reach
Are you located in NRW (and if you don't know what NRW is the answer is likely "No". That's OK too)
answers.answer: Most of the time - but I am also spending time on the road whenever I can.

group_profile.intro: Travel addicted foodie with a background in IT and business. Passionate about usability.

organizers.name: AK A.
organizers.bio:
Admin account for Ann-Katrin - just for this group/ GDG, do not contact. Look for Ann-Katrin instead, which is the actual account used for organising/communication.
This account is a purely created for formalities
